#for visualization
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.2e90a7ee:
#reading data from file
gufh_data = pd.read_csv('/kaggle/input/gufhtugu-publications-dataset-challenge/GP Orders - 5.csv',encoding="utf-8", delimiter=',')
source.8bce404d:
#checking unique no of values in columns
gufh_data.nunique()
source.8c9afcfb:
#Checking number of null values in column
gufh_data.isnull().sum()
source.daf1e4b9:
#null values in Book Name
gufh_data[gufh_data['Book Name'].isna()]
source.a0f2d4a3:
#null value in payment column
gufh_data[gufh_data['Payment Method'].isna()]
source.c83c867a:
#drop the duplicate record if any 
gufh_data.drop_duplicates(keep=False, inplace=True)
source.1f5a32e3:
#splitting the book name by '/'
book_Name = gufh_data['Book Name'].str.split('/')

#creating a new columns and add to 3 index
gufh_data.insert(3,'Books_Name',book_Name,True)
gufh_data.head()
source.7d70860f:
#Thanks to @Usman Ayaz
#books name with the total selling count
books = gufh_data.Books_Name.explode().value_counts()
book_topTen = dict(books[:10])

k = list(book_topTen.keys())

#printing top ten books name
print('Top Ten Best Selling Books of Ghuftughu Publication\n')

for i in range(len(book_topTen)):
    print(i+1," ", k[i])
source.e18f7ba9: print('The Top selling book of Ghuftughu-Publication is: ', k[0])
source.1bf2a4c5:
v = list(book_topTen.values())

#visualization of top ten selling book
plt.figure()
sns.barplot(x = k , y = v)

plt.title("Top Ten Selling Books of Ghuftughu-Publication ")
plt.xlabel('Books Name')
#thanks to Usman Ayaz
plt.xticks(rotation=95, size=10)
plt.yticks(size=10)
plt.ylabel('Selling Count')

plt.show()
source.e19bacfb:
#dropping nan value from dataset
gufh_data = gufh_data.dropna(axis=0, inplace=False)
source.3acbc39f:
#calculate the correlation of different variable with Order Status
correlation = gufh_data.groupby(['Order Status']).corr()
sns.heatmap(correlation)

plt.title("Correlation of Order Status with other variables")
plt.xlabel('Other Columns')
plt.xticks(size=10)
plt.yticks(size=10)
plt.ylabel('Order Status')
source.e40db587:
#Total number of Orders countdifferent categories
ord_st = gufh_data['Order Status'].value_counts()
print('Order Status Statistics\n', ord_st)
source.f145ce59:
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))
ord_st.plot(kind='bar',color=['Red','green','blue'])
plt.title("Order Status Category division", size=20)
plt.xlabel('Order Status categories', size=15)
plt.ylabel('Order Value Count', size=15)
plt.show()
source.6ab4df3a:
#Cash on delivery values
gufh_data[gufh_data['Payment Method'] == 'Cash on delivery']
source.531fc1db:
#Cash on Delivery (COD) values
gufh_data[gufh_data['Payment Method'] == 'Cash on Delivery (COD)']
source.6b5f926b:
# Replacing the 'Cash on Delivery (COD)' to 'Cash on delivery'
gufh_data = gufh_data.replace('Cash on delivery', 'Cash on Delivery (COD)')
source.a91c7cf0:
pay_mthd = gufh_data['Payment Method'].value_counts()
print('Payment Method Statistics\n',pay_mthd)
source.073ad39e:
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))
pay_mthd.plot(kind='bar', color=['green', 'Yellow', 'blue', 'Pink'])
plt.title('Payment Methods Statistics', size=20)
plt.xlabel('Payment Method', size=15)
plt.ylabel('Count', size=15)
plt.show()

source.ea9e6c43: We have a name of books but the issuse is that the multiple book names in a order are join together with the backslash. We refine the book name column and split the book name in order to find the total unique books value.
